intro: Murdannia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale green flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. It has a short stem and produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Murdannia lanceolata is often found in moist soils and can thrive in areas with partial shade.
